columns.Mountain_ID: A unique identifier for each mountain in the database.
columns.Name: The common name or title of the mountain.
columns.Height: The elevation of the mountain above sea level, measured in meters.
columns.Prominence: The height of the mountain's summit relative to the lowest contour line encircling it, expressed in meters.
columns.Range: The geographical mountain range to which the mountain belongs.
columns.Country: The country or countries in which the mountain is located.

mountain.table_description: The mountain table provides information about various mountains, including their identification, names, physical characteristics such as elevation and prominence, as well as their geographical ranges and locations.

columns.Climber_ID: A unique identifier assigned to each climber in the database.
columns.Name: The full name of the climber.
columns.Country: The country representing the climber's nationality.
columns.Time: The total time taken by the climber to complete the climb.
columns.Points: The score or points earned by the climber based on their performance.
columns.Mountain_ID: A reference identifier that links to the specific mountain the climber ascended.

climber.table_description: The climber table stores information about individual climbers, including their identifiers, names, nationalities, performance times, scoring points, and the mountains they climbed.
